cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of learning distributed representations of sentences, which is a core problem in natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes an unsupervised objective to train sentence embeddings using compositional n-gram features. This makes it likely that the paper belongs to the arXiv sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). 

The paper also uses machine learning techniques to learn these embeddings, which makes it likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel unsupervised objective, which makes it likely to belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

The paper also evaluates its method on benchmark tasks such as sentiment analysis and paraphrase detection, which makes it likely to belong to the sub-category of Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) or Information Retrieval (cs.IR).
